posts.title: Editorial:     â€“  His Majesty the King and Her Majesty the Gyaltsuen are in Vietnam from August 1...
posts.description: Editorial:     â€“  His Majesty the King and Her Majesty the Gyaltsuen are in Vietnam from August 18 to 22 at the invitation of President Luong Cuong, marking the first-ever visit by a Bhutanese Head of State to Vietnam. This historic engagement underscores the maturity of a diplomatic relationship established just over a decade ago and opens new horizons for cooperation in trade, culture, spirituality, and development, among others. https://kuenselonline.com/.../state-visit-heralds... #Vietnam #Bhutan
posts.content: Editorial:     â€“  His Majesty the King and Her Majesty the Gyaltsuen are in Vietnam from August 18 to 22 at the invitation of President Luong Cuong, marking the first-ever visit by a Bhutanese Head of State to Vietnam. This historic engagement underscores the maturity of a diplomatic relationship established just over a decade ago and opens new horizons for cooperation in trade, culture, spirituality, and development, among others. https://kuenselonline.com/.../state-visit-heralds... #Vietnam #Bhutan

posts.title: A total of 6,203 tourists benefitted from subsidised fares during the period Sherab Lhamo Airline...
posts.description: A total of 6,203 tourists benefitted from subsidised fares during the period Sherab Lhamo Airlines have been instructed to discontinue the subsidised airfare scheme for tourists, following a directive issued by the Department of Tourism (DoT) in August. The order, according to Drukair CEO Tandi Wangchuk, came from the Ministry of Finance. He said that the DoT is working to reimburse airlines for tickets already sold under the scheme. https://kuenselonline.com/.../government-discontinues... #DoT #Tourism #TCB #Bhutan
posts.content: A total of 6,203 tourists benefitted from subsidised fares during the period Sherab Lhamo Airlines have been instructed to discontinue the subsidised airfare scheme for tourists, following a directive issued by the Department of Tourism (DoT) in August. posts.description: Perspective: â€™       I arrived in Bhutan for the 2025 Bhutan Echoes literary festival expecting postcard beautyâ€“the valleys, the mountains, the wind-tossed prayer flags. What I found was a deeper national treasure: a culture where kindness is instinct, and strangers become friends before you know their names. https://kuenselonline.com/.../bhutans-bold-step-toward... #GMC #GNH #GDP #Bhutan

posts.title: â€˜               â€™ Our vision is to make Paro FC synonymous with excellence in Bhutanese football
posts.description: . We aspire to be a club that consistently represents Bhutan at the AFC level and competes against some of the best teams in Asia. Beyond football results, we want to create a professionally managed, financially sustainable club with modern infrastructure and strong governance. A key part of this vision is to establish a high-standard academy that nurtures local players into future national stars. At the same time, we aim to build a passionate and loyal fan base, making Paro FC a benchmark for professional football in Bhutan. https://kuenselonline.com/.../our-vision-is-to-show... #sports #ParoFC #football #Bhutan
posts.content: â€˜               â€™ Our vision is to make Paro FC synonymous with excellence in Bhutanese football. We aspire to be a club that consistently represents Bhutan at the AFC level and competes against some of the best teams in Asia. Beyond football results, we want to create a professionally managed, financially sustainable club with modern infrastructure and strong governance. A key part of this vision is to establish a high-standard academy that nurtures local players into future national stars. At the same time, we aim to build a passionate and loyal fan base, making Paro FC a benchmark for professional football in Bhutan. https://kuenselonline.com/.../our-vision-is-to-show... #sports #ParoFC #football #Bhutan

Those who scored 55 and above in PE will be eligible to sit for the main Examination. A total of 1726 graduates who have scored above the cut-off mark in PE, and 698 graduates who were waived from the requirement to appear PE will sit for the Main Examination (ME) scheduled to be held on 9, 10, and 11th, October 2025. In line with section 5.8.2 of BCSR 2023, candidates will be allowed to appeal for a recount. Candidates are required to submit the application form requesting the recounting of the PE score within 5 working days from August 21   27, 2025, and submit it to the Exam Office behind Drukair Office, Chubachu, Thimphu, or email it to bcse@rcsc.gov.bt Download Appeal recounting form : click here https:  shorturl.at BrHgZ ğƒğğ‚ğ”ğŒğ„ğğ“ ğ•ğ„ğ‘ğˆğ…ğˆğ‚ğ€ğ“ğˆğğ ğ…ğğ‘ ğğ‚ğ’ğ„ - ğŸğŸğŸğŸ“ The next step for the BCSE 2025 is  document verification . Graduates are requested to follow the schedule as far as possible. Click here for the result: https:  bcse.rcsc.gov.bt Login

posts.title: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 p...
posts.description: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 participants, including media professionals, officials from the Ministry of Health, WHO Bhutan, Dratshang Lhentshog, and Civil Society Organisations. Delivering the keynote address, Health Minister Lyonpo Tandin Wangchuk stressed that  a resilient and equitable health system is not built by health professionals alone, but by a society that is informed, engaged, and empowered.  He emphasized the media s vital role in bridging science and society, countering misinformation, and shaping healthier communities. Bhupinder Kaur Aulakh (PhD), WHO Representative to Bhutan, in her remarks today highlighted the crucial role of media in driving advocacy, awareness, and behavior change in public health. Source: WHO Bhutan #HealthForAll #MediaWorkshop2025 #Bhutan #HealthCommunication #ResilientSystems #PartnershipsForHealth
posts.content: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 participants, including media professionals, officials from the Ministry of Health, WHO Bhutan, Dratshang Lhentshog, and Civil Society Organisations. Delivering the keynote address, Health Minister Lyonpo Tandin Wangchuk stressed that  a resilient and equitable health system is not built by health professionals alone, but by a society that is informed, engaged, and empowered.  He emphasized the media s vital role in bridging science and society, countering misinformation, and shaping healthier communities. Bhupinder Kaur Aulakh (PhD), WHO Representative to Bhutan, in her remarks today highlighted the crucial role of media in driving advocacy, awareness, and behavior change in public health. Source: WHO Bhutan #HealthForAll #MediaWorkshop2025 #Bhutan #HealthCommunication #ResilientSystems #PartnershipsForHealth

posts.description: August 19, 2025: On Their Majesties  ongoing State Visit to Viá»‡t Nam, His Majesty The King and Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen paid tribute to President Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh   the founder of modern Viá»‡t Nam, and to the nation s war heroes and martyrs. Their Majesties visited the Monument to Heroes and Martyrs to honour Viá»‡t Nam s fallen heroes, and the Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh Mausoleum, the final resting place of the revolutionary leader. Their Majesties were then received in an official ceremony by President LÆ°Æ¡ng CÆ°á»ng and Madame Nguyá»…n Thá»‹ Minh Nguyá»‡t at the Presidential Palace with a Guard of Honour. His Majesty The King held a meeting with the President of Viá»‡t Nam, accompanied by the delegation from Bhutan. Two Memoranda of Understanding between Bhutan and Viá»‡t Nam on cooperation between the two governments and cooperation in aviation were signed in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Viá»‡t Nam. Meanwhile, Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen and Madame Nguyá»…n Thá»‹ Minh Nguyá»‡t visited Tráº¥n Quá»‘c Pagoda, the oldest Buddhist temple in HÃ  Ná»™i. Her Majesty and the First Lady were received by the abbot, Most Venerable ThÃ­ch Thanh NhÃ£, and offered incense and prayers at the temple. In the afternoon, His Majesty met with the General Secretary of the Communist Party of Viá»‡t Nam TÃ´ LÃ¢m, Prime Minister Pháº¡m Minh ChÃ­nh, and Chairman of the National Assembly Tráº§n Thanh Máº«n. In the evening, the President and Madame Nguyá»…n Thá»‹ Minh Nguyá»‡t hosted a State Banquet in honour of Their Majesties. Source: His Majesty King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck

Solutions are rare, even though this substance has long been identified as a root cause of many evils including in the teachings of Lord Buddha. While we may not be able to eliminate alcohol completely, a small initiative could make a big difference: protecting our children from early exposure to it. https:  kuenselonline.com news a-pledge-we-must-all-make #alcohol #editorial #Bhutan

posts.title: Update of His Majesty s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Servic...
posts.description: Update of His Majesty s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Services Agreement was signed on August 19, 2025 between the Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport, Bhutan and the Civil Aviation Authority, Ministry of Construction, The Government of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Viet Nam. The objective of the MoU is to promote aeronautical relations in a spirit of cooperation and understanding for the benefit of both countries. #Update #energy #Aviation
posts.content: Update of His Majesty s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Services Agreement was signed on August 19, 2025 between the Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport, Bhutan and the Civil Aviation Authority, Ministry of Construction, The Government of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Viet Nam. The objective of the MoU is to promote aeronautical relations in a spirit of cooperation and understanding for the benefit of both countries. #Update #energy #Aviation

posts.title: Just in: The Supreme Court upheld the earlier rulings, confirming Tashi Dorji s conviction for a ...
posts.description: Just in: The Supreme Court upheld the earlier rulings, confirming Tashi Dorji s conviction for a fourth-degree felony and affirming the High Court s sentence of three years and four months in prison. The verdict was passed today. The former MP Tashi Dorji of Nubi_Tangsibji consituency in Trongsa was charged for molesting a child in 2022. The incident occurred when he was serving as a Gewog Administrative Officer. The case was filed in court in October last year.
